name: Vantra Vegan
editorial_summary: Raw & cooked vegan dishes, along with a buffet, in a small, light, plant-filled cafe.

reviews.text:
The cracker chaat and the cracker appetizers were good. The  Dragon roll sushi was excellent. The lentil dish and curry Laksa were disappointing. The lentil dish had a strange sauce on it that made it inedible. The Laksa had heat but was bland in flavor.

We also had a smoothie, juice and teas all of which were excellent.

The service was slow even when the restaurant was not busy.

Some dishes are good, some are strange.

Recommend the exotic curry! Great flavors, great choice of vegetables that go with it.

Avoid the rainbow dish, felt like random vegetables thrown together with vastly different tastes that don't go together well.

Drinks are on the pricier side.

Amazing quite place in middle of busy London! Food is delicious well balanced! Fast and nice staff member.

Our favorite was dragon roll & gorilla green raw salad ü•ó

Vantra was an excellent discovery. The service was warm and attentive.  Our server mentioned it was only their third shift and handled everything with ease. They offered to box our food without us asking, which was appreciated.

The menu offers a vast selection, including cocktails and puddings. I had the Dan Dan Mian with tofu lamb, which looked so good my friend ordered it too. My boyfriend chose the chat, which he also enjoyed, and tasted good to me!

We loved it so much we stayed for another round of drinks. Can‚Äôt wait to go back and tackle some more of the menu!

We recently discovered Vantra during a short trip to London, and I‚Äôm so glad we did! Honestly, it turned out to be one of the best dining experiences I‚Äôve ever had.

We started with the vegan ‚Äúmeat‚Äù skewers in a peanut-like sauce. So flavorful that we kept the plate on the table just to dip our fries into the sauce later (it was that good!). Then came a kind of flatbread topped with fresh ingredients, and finally the absolute highlight: a sushi burger served with a mix of potato and sweet potato fries, delicious dips, and a side salad. Now, I usually don‚Äôt even eat salad, but this one had a yogurt-based dressing that was so tasty I practically devoured it. Everything on that plate was a win.

What stood out to me is how Vantra manages to cook with a focus on health and protein-rich meals, but without ever falling into the ‚Äúhealthy but tasteless‚Äù stereotype. Everything was vibrant, flavorful, and satisfying. The whole menu felt unique and adventurous! Nothing ‚Äústandard‚Äù or boring, but carefully thought-out dishes that make you excited to try something new.

The drinks menu was just as impressive. They had a wide variety of creative cocktails and ‚ÄúVocktails‚Äù. As someone who loves alcohol-free cocktails, I was thrilled to see so many tasty options. I could have happily tried them all! My boyfriend went for a milkshake and it was equally tasty.

The atmosphere at Vantra was another highlight. My partner and I are both neurodivergent, and after a full day in busy, overwhelming London, stepping into this restaurant felt like entering another world. The lighting was gentle (bright enough but not harsh), the music was calm, and we could talk easily without raising our voices. Another big plus was that the restaurant wasn‚Äôt crowded or noisy. There was enough space to feel comfortable and relaxed. We actually asked about it, and were told that while it can be busier on event days, it‚Äôs usually a peaceful place to eat. That made the whole experience even more enjoyable for us. Even the restrooms were clean and well-kept, which for me is always an important detail and a definite plus.

The service was kind and welcoming throughout, and at the end we even had a lovely chat with one of the staff members who explained more about the restaurant. She mentioned how fully vegan restaurants are unfortunately declining in the UK, which made me feel even more strongly about supporting places like Vantra. They absolutely deserve it.

The only minor point I could mention is that there isn‚Äôt a menu available on the website. But after hearing the reason (the menu changes seasonally, depending on what‚Äôs available), it made perfect sense and actually reflects the restaurant‚Äôs commitment to freshness and creativity.

All in all, Vantra is an absolute must-visit, not only for vegans but for anyone open to trying something truly unique and delicious. We left so happy with our choice and will definitely return next time we‚Äôre in London!
